name: undergo
content:

C1 to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change: She underwent an operation on a tumour in her left lung last year. Playing board games is undergoing a revival in popularity.
More examplesFewer examplesHe seems to have undergone a change in attitude recently, and has become much more co-operative.After the accident, he underwent reconstructive surgery to rebuild his face.I had to undergo a medical examination when I started my pension scheme.Athletes must undergo a mandatory drugs test before competing in the championship.The company is undergoing a radical reorganization.
